html: Today we're reintroducing the #EqualityAct. My hope is every LGBTQ American who's been bullied or discriminated against, knows that in the halls of Congress – weyou, weyou, weyou. This bill isn't demanding special treatment – it's demanding equal justice under law.
text:
Today we're reintroducing the #EqualityAct. My hope is every LGBTQ American who's been bullied or discriminated against, knows that in the halls of Congress – weyou, weyou, weyou. 

This bill isn't demanding special treatment – it's demanding equal justice under law.

html: I'm proud that New Jersey provides legal protections for our LGBTQ neighbors, but in 30 states, LGBTQ people are at risk of being fired, refused housing or denied services because of who they are. I join my colleagues in Congress to pass the #EqualityAct now.pic.twitter.com/cemFBWkQuO
text: I'm proud that New Jersey provides legal protections for our LGBTQ neighbors, but in 30 states, LGBTQ people are at risk of being fired, refused housing or denied services because of who they are. I join my colleagues in Congress to pass the #EqualityAct now.pic.twitter.com/cemFBWkQuO

text:
Last year, @StateDept erased #reprorights from the annual Human Rights Reports. Not on my watch. 

I joined 158 of my colleagues to introduce the #ReproRightsAreHumanRights Act, which would reinstate #reprorights in the annual reports. #WomensHistoryMonth

html: I’d like to remind everyone recognizing #InternationalWomensDay that the gender pay gap persists in the United States. Today, a woman’s earnings are 80% of a man’s. The gap is even worse for Hispanic (53%), Black (61%), AIAN (58%), and Native Hawaiian women (62%).

text:
.@RepBonnie: What is a chainlink fence enclosed into a chamber on a concrete floor? A cage?

@SecNielsen: It's a detention space, mam

REP BONNIE: Is it different from what you put dogs in?

NIELSEN: Yes

REP BONNIE: In what sense?

NIELSEN: It's larger

B: Sounds like a dog cagepic.twitter.com/hcIEv4zwrE

html: .@RepBonnie: What is a chainlink fence enclosed in a chamber on a concrete floor/is that a cage? Nielsen: It's a detention space. Rep: Is it different from the space you put your dogs in? Nielsen: It's larger. It provides a space to sit, to stand. Rep: So does my dog's cage.
text:
.@RepBonnie: What is a chainlink fence enclosed in a chamber on a concrete floor/is that a cage?

Nielsen: It's a detention space.

Rep: Is it different from the space you put your dogs in?

Nielsen: It's larger. It provides a space to sit, to stand.

Rep: So does my dog's cage.

html: Cliff Notes: the Constitution entrusts the House of Representatives with the appropriations of the peoples' money because they are the most immediately responsive to the will of their constituents. This was designed to prevent tyranny of the executive. 5/
text: Cliff Notes: the Constitution entrusts the House of Representatives with the appropriations of the peoples' money because they are the most immediately responsive to the will of their constituents. This was designed to prevent tyranny of the executive. 5/

html: This power over the purse may... be regarded as the most complete and effectual weapon with which any constitution can arm the immediate representatives of the people, for obtaining a redress of every grievance, and for carrying into effect every just and salutary measure. 4/
text: This power over the purse may... be regarded as the most complete and effectual weapon with which any constitution can arm the immediate representatives of the people, for obtaining a redress of every grievance, and for carrying into effect every just and salutary measure. 4/

html: Mr. President, I know you don't pay much mind to the Constitution, but may i highlight an important section for you. "No money shall be drawn from the Treasury, but in Consequence of Appropriations made by Law" - Article One, Section 9 Allow me to turn it over to James Madison 1/
text:
